author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm offers actionable insights and learnings on how to get the most out of UEFN—whether you're making the switch from Unreal Engine or looking to deepen your skills as a UEFN developer. Learn how to work smarter, push creative boundaries, and unlock more of what’s possible within Fortnite's toolset.

The session explores how to bring proven Unreal Engine workflows into UEFN: clean folder structures, proper asset types, the use of modular design, and custom editor layouts that support efficiency and clarity. Along the way, gain a better understanding of UEFN’s asset editors and how to organize projects for long-term scalability.

The session also takes a look at the limits of UEFN and how to work around them. Many powerful tools from Unreal Engine—like Material Functions, Textures, Particle Effects, Control Rigs, Animations, and post-processing tricks—can still be used, giving you an edge when creating more advanced experiences.

The last part
title: Beyond the Basics: Unlocking UEFN with an Unreal Mindset | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video and learn how to leverage the Camera Vector expression in Unreal Engine 5.7 to create a stylized comic ink-like outline.

Visit the EDC for more on this tutorial: https://dev.epicgames.com/community/learning/tutorials/o9Xa/unreal-engine-stylized-rendering-a-simple-outline]
Don’t miss the other episodes in our Animation Hub series—a collection of tutorials designed to get you up to speed with animation in Unreal Engine, fast. 

Want to learn more about animating in Unreal Engine? Take a look here: unrealengine.com/uses/animation

#Animation, #UnrealEngine, #CameraVector, #StylizedRendering, #UE5, #Comic
title: Stylized Rendering—A Simple Outline | Unreal Engine Animation Hub
